definitions.text: a large and unbroken expanse or distance
the act of physically reaching or thrusting out
a straightaway section of a racetrack
exercise designed to extend the limbs and muscles to their full extent
extension to or beyond the ordinary limit
examples: by no stretch of the imagination
beyond any stretch of his understanding

definitions.text: an unbroken period of time during which you do something
examples: he did a stretch in the federal penitentiary

definitions.text: the capacity for being stretched
occupy a large, elongated area
examples: The park stretched beneath the train line

definitions.text: extend one's limbs or muscles, or the entire body
examples: Extend your right arm above your head

definitions.text: extend or stretch out to a greater or the full length
examples: stretch out that piece of cloth

definitions.text: become longer by being stretched and pulled
make long or longer by pulling and stretching
lie down comfortably
examples: To enjoy the picnic, we stretched out on the grass

definitions.text: pull in opposite directions
examples: During the Inquisition, the torturers would stretch their victims on a rack

definitions.text: extend the scope or meaning of; often unduly
corrupt, debase, or make impure by adding a foreign or inferior substance; often by replacing valuable ingredients with inferior ones
increase in quantity or bulk by adding a cheaper substance
examples: stretch the soup by adding some more cream
extend the casserole with a little rice

definitions.text: extend one's body or limbs
examples: Let's stretch for a minute--we've been sitting here for over 3 hours

definitions.text: having an elongated seating area
easily stretched
